resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

nevi-me commented on pull request #5971: ARROW-7325: [Rust] [Parquet] Update to parquet-format 2.6 and thrift 0.12
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5971#discussion_r354164307
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/parquet/src/basic.rs
 ##########
 @@ -405,29 +405,29 @@ impl fmt::Display for ColumnOrder {
 impl convert::From<parquet::Type> for Type {
     fn from(value: parquet::Type) -> Self {
         match value {
-            parquet::Type::BOOLEAN => Type::BOOLEAN,
-            parquet::Type::INT32 => Type::INT32,
-            parquet::Type::INT64 => Type::INT64,
-            parquet::Type::INT96 => Type::INT96,
-            parquet::Type::FLOAT => Type::FLOAT,
-            parquet::Type::DOUBLE => Type::DOUBLE,
-            parquet::Type::BYTE_ARRAY => Type::BYTE_ARRAY,
-            parquet::Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY => Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY,
+            parquet::Type::Boolean => Type::BOOLEAN,
 
 Review comment:
   @kornholi @liurenjie1024 @sunchao do you think it would be disruptive to change the local enums like `Type` and `LogicalType` to have camel casing? I'm assuming we've had them as upper case because earlier versions of `thrift` generated them like that?
 
----------------------------------------------------------------
This is an automated message from the Apache Git Service.
To respond to the message, please log on to GitHub and use the
URL above to go to the specific comment.
 
For queries about this service, please contact Infrastructure at:
users@infra.apache.org

kornholi commented on pull request #5971: ARROW-7325: [Rust] [Parquet] Update to parquet-format 2.6 and thrift 0.12
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5971#discussion_r354167146
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/parquet/src/basic.rs
 ##########
 @@ -405,29 +405,29 @@ impl fmt::Display for ColumnOrder {
 impl convert::From<parquet::Type> for Type {
     fn from(value: parquet::Type) -> Self {
         match value {
-            parquet::Type::BOOLEAN => Type::BOOLEAN,
-            parquet::Type::INT32 => Type::INT32,
-            parquet::Type::INT64 => Type::INT64,
-            parquet::Type::INT96 => Type::INT96,
-            parquet::Type::FLOAT => Type::FLOAT,
-            parquet::Type::DOUBLE => Type::DOUBLE,
-            parquet::Type::BYTE_ARRAY => Type::BYTE_ARRAY,
-            parquet::Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY => Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY,
+            parquet::Type::Boolean => Type::BOOLEAN,
 
 Review comment:
   I'm somewhat confused why these duplicate enums exist in the first place. If we're going to depend on a specific version of `parquet-format`, why not use the types from there directly?

sunchao commented on pull request #5971: ARROW-7325: [Rust] [Parquet] Update to parquet-format 2.6 and thrift 0.12
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5971#discussion_r354451932
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/parquet/src/basic.rs
 ##########
 @@ -405,29 +405,29 @@ impl fmt::Display for ColumnOrder {
 impl convert::From<parquet::Type> for Type {
     fn from(value: parquet::Type) -> Self {
         match value {
-            parquet::Type::BOOLEAN => Type::BOOLEAN,
-            parquet::Type::INT32 => Type::INT32,
-            parquet::Type::INT64 => Type::INT64,
-            parquet::Type::INT96 => Type::INT96,

-            parquet::Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY => Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY,

 Review comment:
   I think originally this was to give an isolation between the Thrift definitions and the definitions in parquet-rs, and also allow us to rename things a little differently.

sunchao commented on pull request #5971: ARROW-7325: [Rust] [Parquet] Update to parquet-format 2.6 and thrift 0.12
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/5971#discussion_r354458752
 
 

 ##########
 File path: rust/parquet/src/basic.rs
 ##########
 @@ -405,29 +405,29 @@ impl fmt::Display for ColumnOrder {
 impl convert::From<parquet::Type> for Type {
     fn from(value: parquet::Type) -> Self {
         match value {
-            parquet::Type::BOOLEAN => Type::BOOLEAN,
-            parquet::Type::INT32 => Type::INT32,
-            parquet::Type::INT64 => Type::INT64,
-            parquet::Type::INT96 => Type::INT96,
-            parquet::Type::FLOAT => Type::FLOAT,
-            parquet::Type::DOUBLE => Type::DOUBLE,
-            parquet::Type::BYTE_ARRAY => Type::BYTE_ARRAY,
-            parquet::Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY => Type::FIXED_LEN_BYTE_ARRAY,
+            parquet::Type::Boolean => Type::BOOLEAN,
 
 Review comment:
   Yes the Thrift was using all upper cases before and changed because of the version bump. We may break dependencies if we change the cases for the local enums. Need to be careful with that. I'd say do that in a separate PR later.

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description: {{parquet-format 2.5}} and {{thrift 0.0.4}} bring in outdated versions of third-party crates such as {{byteorder}}, {{ordered-float}}, and {{num-traits}}. Let's update as few of them have reached 1.0.
